post_text: Welcome to New Academy Charter School Facebook page. We are extremely proud of our students and all of their accomplishments. if you are a graduate of New Academy Charter School, please feel free to message us and tell us how you are doing.
text: Welcome to New Academy Charter School Facebook page. We are extremely proud of our students and all of their accomplishments. if you are a graduate of New Academy Charter School, please feel free to message us and tell us how you are doing.

post_text:
Virtual Summer School Allows Students to Maintain Academic Progress

New Academy Charter School has offered summer school options to students for more than a decade. With the COVID-19 pandemic in 2020, our staff and faculty made a commitment to adjust as needed to maintain this valuable opportunity.

This summer, we replaced traditional summer school education with a virtual option via Google Classroom. Students in grades 7-12 were able to earn one credit per session in English, Biology, Civics, Algebra, Geometry, Pre-Algebra, US History, Heath and Phys Ed or Earth Science. 88 students took advantage of this exceptional opportunity. In addition to daily instruction and communication maintained by our teachers via email, phone, facetime and zoom, we also provided over 3600 lunches to our families.

Look forward to an exciting start to the 2020-2021 school year in a few weeks.
If you would like information about enrolling in New Academy Charter Schools, please visit our us on the web or send a PM via Facebook.

https://theacademyschools.com/charter-school/

post_text:
New Academy Charter School Celebrates 2020 Graduates

With senior activities and graduation ceremonies postponed or canceled due to COVID-19, New Academy Charter School faculty and staff made their rounds to visit our graduating seniors and deliver congratulatory yard signs.

The school also plans to hold a socially distant graduation ceremony on Thursday, June 4th for students and limited family members.

Congratulations to our graduates. We wish them all the best of luck in their future endeavors.

post_text: We want to wish all of our students and their families a relaxing Spring Break and while it may be different than we expected, we encourage everyone to follow all recommended guidelines to stay safe, remain healthy and be well.

post_text:
PROVIDING SUPPORT & MEALS DURING COVID-19

New Academy Charter School is committed to ensuring that our students continue to have access to school lunches on a daily basis while we deal with the new normal that has resulted from the ongoing school cancelation. Our incredible faculty and staff have been working to not only provide a nutritious mid-day meal to our students but all maintain critical contact and communication with students and families during this extremely challenging time.
If any student or family is in need of assistance or support while we are off, we encourage you to reach out to the school for information and guidance.
Until we can get back to school, remember to BE SAFE, STAY HOME and BE WELL!!!

post_text: Seniors at New Academy Charter School are provided many opportunities to explore post-secondary academic and career planning opportunities. Students have attended the Mon-Valley College Fair at CCAC South, toured CCAC Northside campus, Rosedale Tech and Triangle Tech and participated in presentations from IUP and Bidwell Training. Upcoming opportunities include visits from UPMC, Giant Eagle and Pittsburgh Career Institute at the school. Planning and preparation for the next steps... learning never ends.

post_text:
New Academy Charter School students participated in a "mindfulness experience during their recent visit to Horses with Hope.
This exercise included using both hands to introduce themselves to the horses, petting their face, ears and body while walking along side and behind the horse, They then completed the process for a second time but their eyes closed. The students were told to focus on the experience of being present in the moment! They also learned how to lead the horses that are used for therapeutic riding!
It is always a wonderful day when visiting Horses with Hope!

post_text:
Because learning is not just academic, New Academy Charter School's Summer School program offers a service learning component for all students.
Projects are focused on several different social issues and completed projects benefit individuals across the Pittsburgh region. Students first learned the difference between volunteerism, service-learning and community service. They also learned some facts and statistics about foster care and how it feels to be a foster kid. The service component involved assembling care bags with personal messages to foster-involved youth which were distributed through Wesley Family Services. They also assembled packaged lunches for clients of the Rainbow Soup Kitchen in Homestead. Proud of our student contributions to our city!!

post_text:
The Academy Charter School hosted its 10th annual Get Your Good On Day of Service. This year, students and staff assembled and painted picnic tables, made plant signs and pavers and built butterfly, bee and bat homes with the staff from Allegheny Land Trust. All of these items were donated to Hilltop Urban Farm. Students also participated in summer garden planting in partnership with the staff from Grow Pittsburgh.
Encouraging community service because true happiness is found in helping others!!

post_text: New Academy Charter School hosted 85 corporate volunteers from BNY Mellon and American Eagle. The volunteers did a variety of projects that included mulching the garden, refreshing the courtyard, painting murals in student restrooms, installing new parking signs and painting throughout the campus. They also installed a new counter top in the main office. We sincerely appreciate their time and talents in helping to make New Academy Charter a fabulous place to learn and grow!

post_text: A group students recently volunteered with the Wrapped in Love Program. This organization consists of women who get together weekly to crochet blankets and hats for people who are ill. Our students learned some basics crocheting skills and made their own crocheted squares which will be attached together to create a blanket. We look forward to seeing the completed project in the near future. New Academy Charter School - educating the mind and feeding the soul.

post_text: Students at New Academy Charter school are working with the Hilltop Urban Farm on their service learning project. Our students are in the beginning phases of the project which include the development of a survey to see what types of programming they will offer at the Youth Farm. Specifically, they will determine how the after-school program will operate, what types of fruits and vegetables they will produce and what educational farming and gardening subjects will be taught. The theme of the project is "Youth Voice" and once the school survey results are collected and compiles, the students will present their recommendations to the Hilltop Urban Farm staff to make selections and move to the next phase of the project... so excited for things to come. #experienceislearning

post_text:
Through a fantastic partnership with the Talerico Group, New Academy Charter School has become the beneficiary of a one-year sponsorship for diapers and wipes to assist our students who are also parents. Sponsors from at least five states across the country responded to project coordinator, Holly McIlwain's request to purchase these supplies to be automatically sent to New Academy Charter School via Amazon. To date, New Academy Charter School parents have received more than 2,036 diapers and wipes.

Thank you to Holly and her team for helping us provide more than an education; providing opportunities for life!!!

post_text:
Celebrating Success In Education

New Academy Charter School faculty and staff are extremely proud of the students who were named to the Honor Roll for the most recent grading period. We recognized 23 students who achieved honor roll, 7 who achieved high honors and 5 students who earned highest honors. Congratulations to all of our students and keep up the good work.

post_text: New Academy Charter School recently had the pleasure of hosting corporate volunteers from companies including BNY Mellon and Bayer Corporation. Groups from both organizations came to complete a variety of projects that greatly enhanced the physical aesthetics of the the school. From painted the exterior courtyard and interior hallways, to cleaning out vacant classrooms to create our new workout room, the faculty and students of New Academy Charter School sincerely appreciate all of the effort contributed by these generous volunteers.

post_text: New Academy Charter School staff and students are excited to add a Learning Garden to the campus. Learning Gardens are accessible outdoor classrooms built to fit organically into any school campus. The Learning Garden was specifically designed for the unique layout of our new school. New Academy Charter School has partnered with staff from Grow Pittsburgh who will support our teachers' use of the Learning Garden today and into the future. Students and staff members planted lettuce, radish, peas, mustard, spinach and different herbs that they will be able to harvest in the next 4-6 weeks.

post_text: New Academy Charter School students participated in an Employment Assistance Workshop. During the workshop, students filled out sample, online job applications and set up gmail accounts for future job searches. A few of the students applied for jobs at places such as Dunkin Donuts, Wendy's and Pizza Hut. They also learned valuable skills related to resume building, interviewing and the best ways to present themselves to potential employers. This workshop is a component of the Career Planning class offered to our Juniors and Seniors as they work to achieve their post-graduation goals.

post_text: New Academy Charter School students recently volunteered at Horses with Hope! The equine therapy program offers opportunities to improve the physical, mental, emotional and social quality of life for children, youth, and adults with physical and behavioral health needs. Our student volunteers serve as side-walkers, assisting riders while allowing them as much independence as possible. This volunteer experience is a favorite of our students and we look forward to continuing our partnership with this outstanding organization.

post_text: New Academy Charter School offers an individualized and supportive learning environment to maximize student achievement and success. One of the unique opportunities offered to students this year is the "peace room". This space offers a calm atmosphere intended to promote relaxation, de-escalation and distress reduction for students struggling with anxiety and conflict. The encouragement, affirmation and positive interaction that the students receive in this room promotes empowerment and confidence in utilizing healthy alternatives to coping with difficult situations and circumstances.

post_text: New Academy Charter School teachers, Samantha Taylor and Bruce Fullard welcomed their 8th grade Teen Living class with a fun icebreaker on the first day of school. The course will teach students about important issues they will face during their high school years. It is designed to help students explore career opportunities, career planning and demonstrate career acquisition skills to enable them become productive citizens within their community. New Academy Charter School... getting kids CAREER-READY!

post_text: Open House Week at New Academy Charter School was a big hit for all who came to visit and learn what we have to offer students in grades 8 - 12 for the upcoming school year. Guests toured classrooms, the library, gymnasium, cafeteria and courtyard while talking to administrators and faculty members about the exceptional opportunities available within our unique and specialized learning environment. New Academy Charter School... because education is your ticket to ride in life!

post_text: This summer, students at New Academy Charter School have completed over 245 hours of community service. They have built and painted birdhouses and butterfly houses for environmental organizations, made no-sew pillows and bedtime bags for foster kids, assembled grab-and-go weekend snack bags for hungry children and packaged coloring books, crayons and get well notes for kids at Children's Hospital. Without a doubt, students at New Academy Charter School are giving back but getting so much more in return!

Without a doubt, students at New Academy Charter School are giving back but getting so much more in return!

post_text: New Academy Charter School is looking ahead to the start of our first full school year in our new home. While we have accomplished many things since moving in several months ago, being a good neighbor in the community remains one of our priorities. Recently, students painted and planted over 50 decorated flower pots. The completed projects were personally delivered by students and their teachers to local residents. We hope the flowers brought happiness to many homes.

post_text: On June 7, The Academy Charter School celebrated graduation for the Class of 2018. Family, friends, and faculty gathered to honor these young men and women for their wonderful academic achievements. The graduates heard an inspiring message from The Academy Charter School Executive Director, Bill Styche before receiving their diplomas. Following the ceremony, the students joined their loved ones for a dinner reception hosted by The Summit Academy Food Service Department. We are so proud of the Class of 2018, and we wish them luck as their pursue their dreams.

post_text: The New Academy Charter School visited the Job Corps facility in Charleston, West Virginia for a tour of their programs. Our students were interested in the carpentry and business administration programs. They were able to tour the dormitories, cafeteria, trade and academic programs. New Academy Charter School is on a mission to continue positive, post-high school transitions through our continued partnership with Job Corps.

New Academy Charter School is on a mission to continue positive, post-high school transitions through our continued partnership with Job Corps.

post_text:
New Academy Charter School recently hosted Employment Representatives from Pitt-Ohio Trucking. They spoke with our students about the company apprenticeship program, as well as job opportunities within the organization. Additionally, they arranged interview times for students seeking entry-level positions this summer.
"A dream does not become reality through magic; it takes sweat, determination and hard work."
– Colin Powell

post_text: A group of soon-to-be graduates from New Academy Charter recently toured Community College of Allegheny County to learn about potential academic opportunities for the fall. Two of our students are interested in pursuing nursing degrees while another is looking forward to a career in culinary arts. Although the remaining students are undecided about their majors, all of the students enjoyed their experience at the school. EDUCATION - it's your ticket to ride in life!

post_text: Recently a group of students participated in an experiential visit to the Trade Institute of Pittsburgh. Run by professional leaders in trade industries, counseling, business, and economic development, the Trade Institute of Pittsburgh offers a ‘hand up, not a hand out’ for individuals looking to create exceptional careers and life opportunities. Our students learned the fundamentals of various construction trades and discussed how acquiring these skills could enable them to create a self-sufficient, productive life. TIP offers an intensive ten-week, education program that our students can now consider as they plan their future academic and career opportunities.

post_text:
The Academy Charter School recently participated in a volunteer experience with World Vision Pittsburgh at their Global Distribution Center where donated products are sorted, processed, and prepared for domestic and international distribution. World Vision is an international humanitarian organization that partners with children, families, and their communities by tackling the causes of poverty and injustice.

During their visit, our students had the opportunity to tour the 40,000 square foot distribution center and learn about the organization's international projects. We also contributed our time and talents by sorting, folding and packaging 940 men's shirts for shipment to one of World Vision's community project.

We hope to have the opportunity to work with World Vision again the future, as we are extremely proud to be a part of their impressive volunteer team.

post_text: Students at The Academy Charter School recently volunteered at the Intersection Soup Kitchen which serves individuals and families in McKeesport and the surrounding area. The program provides nearly 14,000 hot meals per year for individuals who do not have permanent residences or adequate kitchen facilities. For this event, our students created handmade place mats and decorations. They also helped to prepare and serve the meal, as well as clean up the dining hall afterward. The Academy Charter School students are very proud to serve at The Intersection Soup Kitchen... "a crossroads for those who want to give and those in need."

The Academy Charter School students recently completed creative mural projects. These works were designed and painted by teams of students and are currently displayed throughout our school. Additional pieces were also donated to area non-profit organizations.
Encouraging positive attitudes through artistic expression at The Academy Charter School - where pride still matters!

post_text: Yesterday, June 8, was an extra special day for our students. The Academy Charter School celebrated the graduation of 18 bright students. The graduation ceremony featured speakers Charlie Batch, former Pittsburgh Steeler, and Sylvia Wilson, Vice President of the Pittsburgh Public School Board. After the ceremony, the students sat down to a banquet dinner with family, friends, and staff to celebrate their academic achievement. We are so proud of our students' accomplishments, and we have loved watching them grow as young adults. Congrats class of 2017!

post_text: The Academy Charter School is gearing up for their annual Get Ur Good On Day (GUGO) which will be held on campus June 2, 2017! The day consists of several community service project activities, including building and painting eight picnic tables. The uniquely decorated picnic tables will then be donated throughout the community at local parks.

post_text: The Academy Charter School received a grant from Youth Service America to complete a Global Youth Service Day project. The grant was maximized through a partnership with The Greater Pittsburgh Community Food Bank. The project focused on students assembling Grab & Go Snack bags. The bags will be donated to area summer feeding programs to be distributed to kids on Fridays for weekend snacks.

shared_text:
The Academy Schools
February 2, 2017 at 3:53 PM ·

Students from The Academy Charter School shared an exceptional opportunity to volunteer their time and talents with members of the community through an afternoon at The Blessing Board. This organization helps families improve their quality of life by providing necessary furniture and household goods free of charge. The Blessing Board serves families who have been victims of home fires or domestic violence, as well as single parents and veterans. Our students volunteered at the supply warehouse where they moved furniture and loaded trucks for the appreciative recipients. They also organized inventory and stocked items on the showroom floor. The volunteer coordinator at The Blessing Board thanked our students for their help and invited them to return to participate in future projects.

shared_text:
The Academy Schools
January 7, 2016 at 3:27 PM · Pittsburgh, PA ·

The Academy Charter School students and Rainbow Kitchen, partnered together to brighten the holidays and the lives of Pittsburgh-area homeless. The students stuffed holiday stockings with hand-made winter hats, lip balm, shaving cream and razor, facial soap, lotion, Kleenex, shampoo & conditioner, toothpaste and tooth brush and restaurant gift cards. The stockings were then passed out to the Rainbow Kitchen patrons at an event that included lots of smiles and hugs to warm the chilly winter weather.

The Academy Charter School has implemented a Good Neighbor Initiative that allows our students to give back to their community and help them to understand that they are part of a larger society of caring individuals. Our students look forward to continuing to volunteer in future projects.
